en: Personal letter from J. T. Hand to Professor Louis L. McInnis dated February 6, 1882, written from Brenham, Texas. Hand reports on the health condition of their mutual friend Moore, who is bedridden and recovering from illness, and encourages McInnis to write to Moore to lift his spirits. Hand also mentions his own struggle with a severe cold and expresses concern about potential pneumonia.

body.value:
[Header]

Brenham Feb. 6th 1882.

My dear Professor:

I spent some
time with our mutual friend
Moore this P.M. He is still on
his back & is likely to be there for
some time - I call to see him
almost every day - He speaks so
often & so kindly of you - I know
he would enjoy a letter from you
just now - Poor fellow, he will
get well this time, but for the next
attack I have most serious
apprehensions - Moore has a
telescopic view just before him
which occupies much of his thoughts
yet he has time & heart to think of
other friends - As soon as he
can stand on his feet I think
he will marry - Write him
a good long letter - It will
do him good - I am still
almost sick from a fearful
cold - If I escape Neumonia I
shall be thankful - Your friend

[Signature]

Hand
